text: Nonviolence is a philosophy that rejects the use of physical violence. People who practice nonviolence when expressing their beliefs may use methods like education, persuasion, civil disobedience, and conscientious objection to military service. A demonstration by a group of people in a public place, to show their support or to protest, is permitted on the condition that it remain nonviolent. Sometimes the demonstrators are nonviolent but other people who oppose them will come to the demonstration and behave violently to show their opposition. Some religious movements, such as the Society of Friends (Quakers) and Jainism with Ahimsa, are known for the practice of nonviolence. There are people who adopt nonviolence in midlife, such as St. Francis of Assisi. People who eat a vegetarian or vegan diet, and those who support animal rights, usually oppose any violence by humans against animals. ==Famous leaders who practiced nonviolence== *Mahatma Gandhi *Martin Luther King, Jr. *John Lewis ==Related page== *Anti-war movement *Pacifism *Peace *Satyagraha Category:Virtues Category:Ethics Category:Civil disobedience
